item.title: 215 – Blackberry
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blackberry despite the heat we have no orange trees like Thich Nhat Hanh to eat from take instead the fruit off the vine weaving between spines pluck one plump berry black and shining cloistered in cupped hands a censer crushed … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blackberry

despite the heat we have
no orange trees
like Thich Nhat Hanh
to eat from
take instead the fruit
off the vine
weaving between spines
pluck one plump berry
black and shining
cloistered in cupped hands
a censer crushed slow
against the teeth
tasting sweetly sour
blooming in the mouth
a moment drawn
forever

item.title: 214 – Night Deposit
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Night Deposit Girl, I love watching you puzzle out our financial future with a .05mm mechanical pencil and a calculator from Dollar Tree. That twisted tongue stuck out your mouth makes me want to make the baby we’re saving all … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Night Deposit

Girl, I love watching you puzzle
out our financial future
with a .05mm mechanical pencil
and a calculator from Dollar Tree.

That twisted tongue stuck out your mouth
makes me want to make the baby
we’re saving all this up for.

College funds. Baby saving plan. 401(k)s.

Let’s get down on a plush cushion of down payments.

Let’s work up some sweat equity.

With a 3% interest rate locked in
until death do us part, you can amortize
this ROI anytime you want.

No line to wait in. No bullet proof glass
or secret PIN required.

This Any Time Man’s always open
for a night deposit.

item.title: 213 – I am who I am
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: I am who I am Who do you say that I am? Christ Almighty what an artful dodge. His wine goblet runneth over at a crowded house party, pressed to the counter, gently deflecting the question. Yeshua bar-Yoesf always was … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
I am who I am

Who do you say that I am? Christ Almighty
what an artful dodge. His wine goblet runneth over
at a crowded house party, pressed to the counter,
gently deflecting the question. Yeshua bar-Yoesf
always was good with a slick finish, even if
he went against the grain. Never one for straight answers.
A parable man, digging in the dirt when the shit came down,
then losing it in a spastic rage. Love and swords; wheat and chaff
and hushing up the healed. Hard to pin down until the end.
What’s to be done with you, son? Been called many things;
I’ve got a few thoughts of my own. But who you are? Hell if I know.

item.title: 212 – Alligator
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Alligator Maybe there were voices to tell him he was Icarus. Maybe it was drugs. Maybe he’d always wanted to know what it was like, just for a moment. No witnesses. No reports. No trace. From last step to landing … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Alligator

Maybe there were voices to tell him
he was Icarus. Maybe it was drugs.
Maybe he’d always wanted to know
what it was like, just for a moment.

No witnesses. No reports. No trace.

From last step to landing a count
of three-alligators. Time enough
to swallow, shout and point out
where he’d barely been.

One-alligator. Two-alligator. Three-alligator.

Quick as we could we started hunting
for the black box. His orange shirt,
the missing sandals on the street below.
Wondering at the firemen in their slow step.

No body. No hurry. Nothing to see here, folks.

The hole he tore in the sky, gone
in under an hour. Traffic back. Food carts
serving up fresh gyros. The garlic sizzle
tears a body up.

No name. No clue. Nothing to do.

Flag still flies at the top
of the mast. Birds meander by.
Never know what happened between
all-knowing and nothing.

One-alligator. Two-alligator. Three-alligator.

item.title: 211 – 10 Stories
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: 10 Stories *On 7/30/14, a man fell/lept/was pushed from the roof of an office building in SW Portland. Accidental: He happened to get too close to the edge. Cry for Help:  It was a thought he didn’t want. Delusional: He … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
10 Stories

*On 7/30/14, a man fell/lept/was pushed from the roof of an office building in SW Portland.

Accidental: He happened to get too close to the edge.

Cry for Help:  It was a thought he didn’t want.

Delusional: He was out of his mind.

Hesitantly Intentional: He knew what he was doing, but slipped into it.

Committed: He wore running shoes.

Crime of Passion: They fought; he fell.

Crime of Opportunity: Drugs or money and a slick edge.

Homicide: Personal and/or professional malice.

Nihilistic: Does it matter?

Act of God: a Divine reminder.

item.title: 210 – Medallion
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Medallion Don the hand from the remains of the crater. Find shrapnel to pierce and thread twine through the thick wrist. Second heartbeat claps heavy against your chest when next you run to shelter. Phantom-flex of the dead fingers reach … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Medallion

Don the hand
from the remains
of the crater.

Find shrapnel to pierce
and thread twine
through the thick wrist.

Second heartbeat claps heavy
against your chest
when next you run to shelter.

Phantom-flex of the dead
fingers reach out
to all you pass.

Hammered ring glints
gold. A little fire
huddled in the dark.

item.title: 209 – Tabernacle
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Tabernacle If the body’s a temple I’m a trapaulin tent animal skin stretched over bone braces, made for travel and quick packing at the sight of trouble or the descending Whirlwind. Ages of dust and incense can’t scrub the blood … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Tabernacle

If the body’s a temple
I’m a trapaulin tent
animal skin stretched over bone
braces, made for travel
and quick packing
at the sight of trouble
or the descending Whirlwind.

Ages of dust and incense can’t scrub
the blood clean. Smell of hair
and the last moments of slaughter
before being raised up
to new life. The cross-beams
fail; the hide panels wear out.

Carted around the desert
at the mercy of hands
that don’t understand their own
function. Left out to be filled
with the punishing wind
that clenases

and fills a moment whole
then gone, deflated, empty
of anything but the space held
a space of nothing waiting
for the next roiling storm
to roll across the desert

item.title: 208 – Barnacle
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Barnacle He’s the trench-coat wearing kind of kid who in his head hoists a boombox in the rain to serenade the love of his life. He’s a goldfish-in-the-castle keeping an eye out, hiding behind a jungle mustache and constant shrug. … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Barnacle

He’s the trench-coat wearing kind
of kid who in his head hoists
a boombox in the rain to serenade
the love of his life.

He’s a goldfish-in-the-castle
keeping an eye out, hiding
behind a jungle mustache
and constant shrug.

He’s microscopes and magic tricks
that falter just enough to get you
to hope and fall. He knew all along.
You pull for him to be

the thing you’d expect: normalized
in some unclear way. Less honest.
More typically effervescent
yet opaque.

He’s who Darwin loved, maybe
was, the salted carbuncle clinging
to the hull, tasting the sea
without getting shipwrecked.

Temperature-taker, side-eyer
long-game-player, fantasizer
who might just make it out
of the box in his head, maybe

hitch a ride on a junk
to China. Uncover a lost city
and become a god to its people.
Return home to settle

the rocking chair, bar stool
in the back corner, nodding
without ever giving up much
nothing you’d never suspect.

He’ll die or disappear
with or without dates known,
just a long line carved
to keep us all guessing.

item.title: 207 – Exhaustion
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Exhaustion is the heavy pipe carried in the eye sawdust lamentations of a restless mind worry grinds the axe til dawn blood-red rust clots a bluebird sky all is sandstorm taste of dust jointed blur moment unhinged from moment to … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Exhaustion

is the heavy pipe
carried in the eye

sawdust lamentations
of a restless mind

worry grinds the axe
til dawn

blood-red rust clots
a bluebird sky

all is sandstorm
taste of dust

jointed blur
moment unhinged

from moment
to the end

of what’s to come
rest

far off bright
emptiness

a pool
slowly filling

item.title: 206 – Funeral for the Father of the Bride
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Funeral for the Father of the Bride Flip the bouquets, swap the black ribbon for white lace, gin up the organ some, loosen your tie a little and holler new hymns to the choir. Rose petals’ll smile just as well … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Funeral for the Father of the Bride

Flip the bouquets, swap the black ribbon
for white lace, gin up the organ some,
loosen your tie a little and holler
new hymns to the choir. Rose petals’ll smile
just as well as wilt.
The minister’s worth his salt: tragedy shimmers
into joy in the blink of an eye. Do you? Do you?
Stand and clap at the kiss–the old man won’t roll,
from his vantage he knows the tears do double-duty.
Afterwards, out on the green lawn, toast him under
and the new couple to a long and happy life,
God-willing. Shake the warm hands around you,
swap stories of the young and the dead. Wear a tread
in the dance floor, savoring your brief moment
with the shinning bride. Drink deep of the wine,
see them off at last light in a shower of rice and light.
On the long walk back, hum a funeral dirge in the dark,
at home in your one good suit.
